BetaTrees 1.0.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Creating a Beta Trees Histogram
    • Mode Hunting with Beta Trees

    Select nodes in the histogram

    SelectNodes.Rd

    Extract maximal (w.r.t. inclusion, i.e. tree order) nodes that are bounded and whose empirical density is within confidence bounds.

    SelectNodes(node, B, ahat, n)

    Arguments

    node

    A k-d tree with confidence thresholds, output from SetBounds.

    B

    A matrix.

    ahat

    A vector of confidence levels at each depth, starting at depth = 1. Output of the funtion ConfLevel

    n

    Total number of observations.

    Value

    A matrix of rectangles in the histogram of obs. in the input node. A region in the histogram is represented by a row, which contains the lower and upper bounds, empirical density, lower and upper confidence bounds of this node, number of obs. and the depth of the node.

    Details

    A bounded node is selected if the empirical density is within the confidence bounds. The empirical density is $$ h = \frac{n+1}{N |R|}, $$ where \(N\) is the number of obs., and \(n\) is the number of obs. in the region, and \(|R|\) is the volume of the region. Otherwise, if the node is not a leaf, move on to the left and right children of the node.

    Contents

    Developed by Qian Zhao, Guenther Walther.
